instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_BC_ACOK: What is SMC_BC_ACOK? This is identical to CHGR_ACOK. This will come out of the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging chip when CHGR_ACIN & CHGR_DCIN are present, and is necessary for the onewire circuit to begin working. On most Macbooks, CHGR_ACOK needs to be present in order for PP3V42_G3H to flow to the onewire circuit so that the circuitry that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC will turn on.  .
definitions.SYS_ONEWIRE: What is SYS_ONEWIRE? This is a bidirectional communication line between the system management controller(SMC) and the charger that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC. This must be working for the light to come on on the magsafe charger. .
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b no green light and ppbus
threads.message:
Its water damaged board and there is no green light.
pp3v42 is 3.56 volts and i am getting <SIGNAL>SMC_BC_ACOK</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>SYS_ONEWIRE</SIGNAL> signals on respected chips but i still don't get green light on charger, i have tried reflowing smc but still nothing happened.


What else should I try?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b no green light and ppbus
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> has correct level?
Post exact voltage for <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>.
Also check voltages for <CHIP>U6900</CHIP>/01.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b no green light and ppbus
threads.message:
Smc reset have 3.5volts
and <CHIP>U6901</CHIP> have 3.5 on pin 1,4,5
<CHIP>U6990</CHIP> have 3.5 on 1,2,4,5

can it be because pp3v42 is 3.58 instead on 3.42?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b no green light and ppbus
threads.message:
Change battery of your multimeter and test again.
Low battery causes higher readings...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b no green light and ppbus
threads.message:
I think its probably dead, there was explosion on firewire circuit, and it has destroyed many traces underneath that chip
and there is short on 3v3s0 line aswell

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b no green light and ppbus
threads.message: You didn't tell anything about <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>, but this really looks like dead board reading your last post...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b no green light and ppbus
threads.message: I managed to restore ppbus and it was around 12.30volts and green light did came up for few minutes but then i saw broken traces in second or third layer and a short in s0 rail, so i declared it dead
